contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{taxobox |name = ''Oclemena'' |image = Oclemena nemoralis, Pancake Bay PP.jpg |image_caption = ''Oclemena nemoralis'' (Bog-aster) |regnum = [[Plantae]] |unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] |unranked_classis = [[Eudicots]] |unranked_ordo = [[Asterids]] |ordo = [[Asterales]] |familia = [[Asteraceae]] |tribus = Astereae |genus = '''''Oclemena''''' |subdivision_ranks = Species |subdivision = See text. |}} '''Oclemena''' E.L.Greene, is a small genus of [[flowering plants]] from the sunflower family ([[Asteraceae]]). It is native to northeastern North America, found in wet or dry woodlands, and sometimes in clearings in the woods, or in acid bogs and peat. The finely woolly [[Plant stem|stem]] grows in a zig-zag fashion to a height {{convert|30|-|100|cm|ft|0|abbr=on}}. It may be red at its base. The lanceolate [[Leaf|leaves]] are numerous, arranged in a spiral whorl around a single stem. They can be sharply toothed along the margin (as in O. acuminata) or smooth (as in O. nemoralis). The leaves contain sessile [[resin]] glands. The [[flower]] heads consist of flat-topped pink to rose-violet ray florets and yellow disk florets. There are one to a few on a plant, growing on a slender peduncle. The disk flowers are abruptly expanded at the top. The scarious floral [[bract]]s consist of narrow [[chlorophyll]]ous bands, tinted with purple along the midrib. The stipitate [[ovary|ovaries]] are generally compressed and show on the surface minute, cylindrical [[gland]]s. The fruit is a glandular [[achene]] with a double pappus of two bristled whorls. The [[chromosome]] base number is x=9. The [[Kew]] database [http://www.rbgkew.org.uk/cgi-bin/web.dbs/genlist.pl?COMPOSITAE Vascular Plant Families and Genera] categorizes ''Oclamena'' under the genus ''Aster'' L. But taxonomically, ''Oclemena'' belongs to the North American [[clade]] of the tribe Astereae, as a basal member of one of the main branches (Brouillet, Allen, Semple and Ito 2001). ==Species== <gallery> Image:Oclemena-acuminata01.jpg|Whorled Wood Aster (''Oclemena acuminata'') Image:Oclemena-nemoralis01.jpg|Bog Aster (''Oclemena nemoralis'') </gallery> * ''[[Oclemena acuminata]]'' (Michx.)
